output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in electric circuits, equipping you with the knowledge and skills to analyze and design basic circuits. Further study in advanced circuit analysis, electronics, and power systems is recommended to build upon this foundation.
output.introduction: Welcome to Electric Circuits! This course is designed for intermediate learners who have some basic understanding of electrical concepts. We will delve into circuit analysis techniques, circuit components, and their applications.

chapters.description: Introduction to voltage, current, resistance, and power. Ohm's Law and its applications. Independent and dependent sources.
Resistors in series and parallel. Voltage and current division rules. Equivalent resistance calculations.
Kirchhoff's Current Law (KCL) and Kirchhoff's Voltage Law (KVL). Applying KCL and KVL to solve simple circuits.
Introduction to nodal analysis. Selecting a reference node. Writing nodal equations and solving for node voltages.
Introduction to mesh analysis. Defining mesh currents. Writing mesh equations and solving for mesh currents.
Transforming voltage sources to current sources and vice versa. Simplifying circuits using source transformations.
Introduction to capacitors. Capacitance, voltage, and current relationships. Energy storage in capacitors.
Introduction to inductors. Inductance, voltage, and current relationships. Energy storage in inductors.
Analyzing RC and RL circuits. Time constants. Transient response of RC and RL circuits.
